remarks.format: ## Remarks 實值類型代表範圍從負數 128 到正數 127 的值的整數。The value type represents integers with values ranging from negative 128 to positive 127. > [!IMPORTANT] > 類型不符合 CLS 標準。The type is not CLS-compliant. 符合 CLS 標準的替代類型是。The CLS-compliant alternative type is . 可以用來取代正改為值，範圍從零至。 can be used instead to replace a positive value that ranges from zero to . 如需 cls 符合性的詳細資訊，請參閱[語言獨立性以及與語言無關的元件](~/docs/standard/language-independence-and-language-independent-components.md)。For more information about CLS compliance, see [Language Independence and Language-Independent Components](~/docs/standard/language-independence-and-language-independent-components.md). 提供方法來比較此類型的執行個體、 執行個體的值轉換為其字串表示，並將數字的字串表示轉換成此類型的執行個體。 provides methods to compare instances of this type, convert the value of an instance to its string representation, and convert the string representation of a number to an instance of this type. 格式規格的程式碼控制實值類型的字串表示方式的相關資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For information about how format specification codes control the string representation of value types, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會實作介面並執行稍微優於方法因為並沒有轉換`value`參數物件。This method implements the interface and performs slightly better than the method because it does not have to convert the `value` parameter to an object. 根據您的程式語言，可能會以程式碼方法的參數型別具有較少的位元的位置 （較窄） 與執行個體類型。Depending on your programming language, it might be possible to code a method where the parameter type has fewer bits (is narrower) than the instance type. 這可能是因為有些程式語言會執行隱含擴展轉換，表示參數為型別與相同位元數與執行個體。This is possible because some programming languages perform an implicit widening conversion that represents the parameter as a type with as many bits as the instance. 例如，假設執行個體類型是和參數類型是。For example, suppose the instance type is and the parameter type is . Microsoft C# 編譯器會產生代表做為參數的值指示物件，然後產生比較的值的方法執行個體和參數表示法。The Microsoft C# compiler generates instructions to represent the value of the parameter as an object, then generates a method that compares the values of the instance and the parameter representation. 請參閱您的程式語言的文件，以判斷其編譯器會在數值類型上執行隱含的擴展轉換。Consult your programming language's documentation to determine if its compiler performs implicit widening conversions on numeric types. ## Examples 下列範例示範泛型和非泛型版本的數個值和參考類型的方法。The following example demonstrates generic and nongeneric versions of the method for several value and reference types. remarks.format: ## Remarks `s`參數包含數字的格式：The `s` parameter contains a number of the form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| `s`參數會使用解譯樣式。The `s` parameter is interpreted using the style. 除了位元組值的十進位數字，只允許前置和尾端空白前置正或負號。In addition to the byte value's decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces with a leading positive or negative sign are allowed. 若要明確地定義中可以存在的樣式項目`s`，使用或方法。To explicitly define the style elements that can be present in `s`, use either the or the method. `s`參數使用的格式設定資訊中會剖析，初始化目前的系統文化特性。The `s` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a that is initialized for the current system culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 若要將字串剖析使用其他文化特性格式資訊，請使用方法。To parse a string by using the formatting information of some other culture, use the method. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何將字串值轉換成帶正負號的位元組的值使用方法。The following example demonstrates how to convert a string value into a signed byte value using the method. 主控台然後就會顯示產生的帶正負號的位元組值。The resulting signed byte value is then displayed to the console. remarks.format: ## Remarks `style`參數定義中允許的樣式項目 （例如空白字元或正或負號）`s`剖析作業成功的參數。The `style` parameter defines the style elements (such as white space or the positive or negative sign symbol) that are allowed in the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必須從位元旗標的組合列舉型別。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 值而定`style`、`s`參數可以包含下列項目：Depending on the value of `style`, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] 如果`style`包含、`s`參數可能包含下列項目：If `style` includes , the `s` parameter may contain the following elements: [*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*][*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space. 空白字元可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現在結尾`s`如果樣式包含旗標。White space can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if style includes the flag.| |*$*|特定文化特性的貨幣符號。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字串中的位置由定義目前文化特性的屬性。Its position in the string is defined by the property of the current culture. 目前文化特性的貨幣符號可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign. 符號可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The sign can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 括號可用於`s`來表示負數的值，如果`style`包含旗標。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*|從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9.| |*.**.*|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 目前的文化特性小數點符號可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's decimal point symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*|數字 0-9 的一個或多個如果`style`包含旗標，或是數字 0，如果不存在的一個或多個相符項目。One or more occurrences of the digit 0-9 if `style` includes the flag, or one or more occurrences of the digit 0 if it does not. 小數點後數字才會出現在`s`才`style`包含旗標。Fractional digits can appear in `s` only if `style` includes the flag.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字元，表示此值會表示指數 （科學記號） 表示法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation. `s`參數可代表指數標記法之數字，如果`style`包含旗標。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*exponential_digits**exponential_digits*|數字 0-9 的一或多個項目。One or more occurrences of the digit 0-9. `s`參數可代表指數標記法之數字，如果`style`包含旗標。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*hexdigits**hexdigits*|從 0 到 f 或 0 到 f 的十六進位數字的序列A sequence of hexadecimal digits from 0 through f, or 0 through F.| 十進位數字的字串 (對應於樣式) 一律會成功剖析。A string with decimal digits only (which corresponds to the style) always parses successfully. 在其餘的大部分成員控制可能存在，但不一定要出現在輸入字串中的項目。Most of the remaining members control elements that may be present, but are not required to be present, in the input string. 下表指出如何個別成員會影響的項目可能會出現在`s`。The following digits| |----------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------| ||只有十進位數字。Decimal digits only.| ||小數點 (*。*) 和*fractional_digits*項目。The decimal point (*.*) and *fractional_digits* elements. 不過，如果`style`不包含旗標， *fractional_digits*必須只有一個或多個 0 的數字所組成，否則就會擲回。However, if `style` does not include the flag, *fractional_digits* must consist of only one or more 0 *sign* element in the form of parentheses enclosing the numeric value.| ||群組分隔符號 （，） 項目。The group separator (,) element. 雖然群組分隔符號可出現在`s`，它必須加上只需要一個或多個 0 的數字。Although the group separator can appear in remarks.format: ## Remarks `s`參數包含數字的格式：The `s` parameter contains a number of the form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| `s`參數會使用解譯樣式。The `s` parameter is interpreted using the style. 除了位元組值的十進位數字，只允許前置和後端空格，有前置正負號。In addition to the byte value's decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces with a leading sign are allowed. 若要明確地定義使用的文化特性特有格式設定資訊中可以存在的樣式項目`s`，使用方法。To explicitly define the style elements with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `s`, use the method. `provider`參數是實作其方法會傳回物件，提供特定文化特性格式資訊`s`。The `provider` parameter is an implementation whose method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of `s`. 若要使用的三種方式`provider`參數來提供自訂的格式設定資訊給剖析作業：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply custom formatting information to the parse operation: - 您可以傳遞的實際提供格式設定資訊的物件。You can pass the actual object that provides formatting information. (它的實作只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of simply returns itself.) - 您可以傳遞物件，指定其格式設定為要使用的文化特性。You can pass a object that specifies the culture whose formatting is to be used. 其屬性提供格式設定資訊。Its property provides formatting information. - 您可以傳遞自訂實作。You can pass a custom implementation. 其方法必須具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method must instantiate and return the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`、物件會使用目前文化特性。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例會定義自訂物件，用以定義負號波狀符號 （~）。The following example defines a custom object that defines the tilde (~) as the negative sign. 然後它會剖析數值字串時，使用這個自訂的數目物件以及物件，代表文化特性而異。It then parses a number of numeric strings using this custom object as well as a object that represents the invariant culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks `style`參數定義中允許的樣式項目 （例如空白字元或正或負號）`s`剖析作業成功的參數。The `style` parameter defines the style elements (such as white space or the positive or negative sign symbol) that are allowed in the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必須從位元旗標的組合列舉型別。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 值而定`style`、`s`參數可以包含下列項目：Depending on the value of `style`, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] 如果`style`包含、`s`參數可以包含下列項目：If `style` includes , the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*][*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space. 空白字元可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。White space can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|特定文化特性的貨幣符號。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字串中的位置由定義目前文化特性的屬性。Its position in the string is defined by the property of the current culture. 目前文化特性的貨幣符號可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign. 符號可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現的結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The sign can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 括號可用於`s`來表示負數的值，如果`style`包含旗標。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*|從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9.| |*.**.*|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 目前的文化特性小數點符號可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's decimal point symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*|數字 0-9 的一個或多個如果`style`包含旗標，或是數字 0，如果不存在的一個或多個相符項目。One or more occurrences of the digit 0-9 if `style` includes the flag, or one or more occurrences of the digit 0 if it does not. 小數點後數字才會出現在`s`才`style`包含旗標。Fractional digits can appear in `s` only if `style` includes the flag.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字元，表示此值會表示指數 （科學記號） 表示法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation. `s`參數可代表指數標記法之數字，如果`style`包含旗標。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*exponential_digits**exponential_digits*|從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9. `s`參數可代表指數標記法之數字，如果`style`包含旗標。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*hexdigits**hexdigits*|從 0 到 f 或 0 到 f 的十六進位數字的序列A sequence of hexadecimal digits from 0 through f, or 0 through F.| 十進位數字的字串 (對應於樣式) 一律會成功剖析。A string with decimal digits only (which corresponds to the style) always parses successfully. 在其餘的大部分成員控制可能存在，但不一定要在此輸入字串中出現的項目。Most of the remaining members control elements that may be present, but are not required to be present, in this input string. 下表指出如何個別成員會影響的項目可能會出現在`s`。The following table indicates how individual members affect the elements that may be present in `s`. |非複合`NumberStyles`值Non-composite `NumberStyles` values|在允許的項目`s`除了數字Elements permitted in `s` in addition to digits| |------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------| ||只有十進位數字。Decimal digits only.| ||小數點 (*。*) 和*fractional_digits*項目。The decimal point (*.*) and *fractional_digits* elements. 不過，如果樣式不包含旗標， *fractional_digits*必須只有一個或多個 0 的數字所組成，否則就會擲回。However, if style does not include the flag, *fractional_digits* must consist of only one or more 0 digits; otherwise, an is thrown.| ||"E"或"E"字元，表示指數標記法，連同*exponential_digits*。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates exponential notation, along with *exponential_digits*.| ||*Ws*開頭的項目`s`。The *ws* element at the beginning of `s`.| ||*Ws*結尾處的項目`s`。The *ws* element at the end of `s`.| ||之前的正號*位數*。A positive sign before *digits*.| ||正號之後*位數*。A positive sign after *digits*.| ||括號之前和之後*位數*來表示負數的值。Parentheses before and after *digits* to indicate a negative value.| ||群組分隔符號 (*，*) 項目。The group separator (*,*) element. 雖然群組分隔符號可出現在`s`，它必須加上只需要一個或多個 0 的數字。Although the group separator can appear in `s`, it must be preceded by only one or more 0 digits.| ||貨幣 (*$*) 項目。The currency (*$*) element.| 如果使用旗標，`s`必須是十六進位值。If the flag is used, `s` must be a hexadecimal value. 有效的十六進位數字是 0-9、 a-f 和 A-F。Valid hexadecimal digits are 0-9, a-f, and A-F. 只有其他隨附的旗標可以結合它和。The only other flags that can be combined with it are and . (列舉會包含複合的數字樣式，其中包含這兩個空格旗標。)(The enumeration includes a composite number style, , that includes both white-space flags.) > [!NOTE] > 如果`s`參數為十六進位的數字的字串表示，不加任何裝飾 (例如`0x`或`&h`)，區隔其十六進位數字。If the `s` parameter is the string representation of a hexadecimal number, it cannot be preceded by any decoration (such as `0x` or `&h`) that differentiates it as a hexadecimal number. 這會導致擲回例外狀況，剖析作業。This causes the parse operation to throw an exception. 如果`s`代表十六進位數字，方法會解譯為正負號位元的位元組的高序位位元。If `s` represents a hexadecimal number, the method interprets the high-order bit of the byte as a sign bit. `provider`參數是實作其方法會傳回物件，提供特定文化特性格式資訊`s`。The `provider` parameter is an implementation whose method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of `s`. 若要使用的三種方式`provider`參數來提供自訂的格式設定資訊給剖析作業：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply custom formatting information to the parse operation: - 您可以傳遞的實際提供格式設定資訊的物件。You can pass the actual object that provides formatting information. (它的實作只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of simply returns itself.) - 您可以傳遞物件，指定其格式設定為要使用的文化特性。You can pass a object that specifies the culture whose formatting is to be used. 其屬性提供格式設定資訊。Its property provides formatting information. - 您可以傳遞自訂實作。You can pass a custom implementation. 其方法必須具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method must instantiate and return the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`、物件會使用目前文化特性。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例說明使用方法，將轉換的數字的不同字串表示法帶正負號的整數值。The following example illustrates the use of the method to convert various string representations of numbers to signed integer values. span.span: The string representation of the value of this instance, consisting of a negative sign if the value is negative, and a sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9 with no leading zeroes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式值預設值 （"G"或一般） 目前的文化特性的格式。The method formats an value in the default ("G", or general) format of the current culture. 如果您想要指定不同的格式或文化特性，使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用的多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| 傳回的值會使用一般的數值格式規範 ("G") 的字串表示的格式化值包含負號，如果其值為負數，且範圍從 0 到 9 開頭沒有零的數字的序列。The return value is formatted using the general numeric format specifier ("G") The string representation of the value includes a negative sign if its value is negative, and a sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9 without leading zeros. 定義負號目前的文化特性的物件。The negative sign is defined by the object for the current culture. 若要定義的帶正負號的位元組值的字串表示的格式，請呼叫方法。To define the formatting of the signed byte value's string representation, call the method. ## Examples 下列範例會顯示值使用預設方法。The following example displays an value using the default method. 它也會顯示的字串表示天時，使用標準格式規範數目的值。It also displays the string representations of the value that results from using a number of standard format specifiers. 使用 EN-US 文化特性的格式化慣例來顯示範例。The examples are displayed using the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式值預設值 （"G"或一般） 中指定的文化特性的格式。The method formats an value in the default ("G", or general) format of a specified culture. 如果您想要指定不同的格式或目前的文化特性，使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or the current culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用的多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| `provider`參數是實作。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法會傳回提供這個方法所傳回的字串格式的相關特定文化特性資訊的物件。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of the string returned by this method. 如果`provider`是`null`、值的格式使用目前文化特性的物件。If `provider` is `null`, the value is formatted using the object of the current culture. 只有屬性控制項的字串表示的物件使用一般格式規範的值是，其定義的字元，表示負號。The only property of the object that controls the string representation of the value using the general format specifier is , which defines the character that represents the negative sign. `provider`參數可以是下列其中之一：The `provider` parameter can be one of the following: - A代表的文化特性，提供格式設定資訊的物件。A object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. - 物件，提供格式設定資訊。The object that supplies formatting information. - 自訂物件實作。A custom object that implements . 其方法會傳回物件，提供格式設定資訊。Its method returns the object that supplies formatting information. ## Examples 下列範例會定義自訂物件，並指派"~"字元其屬性。The following example defines a custom object and assigns the "~" character to its property. 然後此範例會使用此自訂物件，以及物件而異的文化特性來格式化一系列的值。The example then uses this custom object as well as the object of the invariant culture to format a series of values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式使用目前文化特性的慣例來指定格式的值。The method formats an value in a specified format by using the conventions of the current culture. 如果您想要使用預設值 （"G"或一般） 格式或指定不同的文化特性，使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to use the default ("G", or general) format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用的多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| `format`參數可以是任何有效的標準數值格式規範或自訂數值格式規範的任何組合。The `format` parameter can be any valid standard numeric format specifier, or any combination of custom numeric format specifiers. 如果`format`等於或`null`，目前的傳回值物件以一般格式規範格式化 ("G")。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the general format specifier ("G"). 如果`format`是任何其他值，則方法會擲回。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 提供廣泛的格式化支援，下列格式的主題中的更詳細地說明：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需.NET Framework 中的格式化支援的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 傳回之字串的格式取決於目前的文化特性的物件。The format of the returned string is determined by the object for the current culture. 取決於`format`參數，這個物件會控制例如負號、 群組分隔符號和小數點符號，輸出字串中的符號。Depending on the `format` parameter, this object controls symbols such as the negative sign, the group separator, and the decimal point symbol in the output string. 若要提供目前的文化特性以外的文化特性格式資訊，請呼叫多載。To provide formatting information for cultures other than the current culture, call the overload. ## Examples 下列範例會初始化陣列值，並且使用每個標準格式字串和一些自訂格式字串來顯示它們。The following example initializes an array of values and displays them by using each standard format string and some custom format strings. 您可以傳遞代表的文化特性，提供格式設定資訊的物件。You can pass a object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. 其方法會傳回提供該文化特性的數值格式設定資訊的物件。Its method returns the object that provides numeric formatting information for that culture. - 您可以傳遞的實際提供數值格式設定資訊的物件。You can pass the actual object that provides numeric formatting information. (它的實作只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of just returns itself.) - 您可以將自訂物件實作。You can pass a custom object that implements . 其方法具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method instantiates and returns the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`，傳回之字串的格式根據目前文化特性的物件。If `provider` is `null`, the formatting of the returned string is based on the object of the current culture. ## Examples 下列範例顯示正數或負數值 使用標準數值格式規範和特定物件。The following example displays both a positive and a negative value using the standard numeric format specifiers and a number of specific objects. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像方法，但是它不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 這個方法就不需要使用例外狀況處理來測試如果`value`無效，無法成功剖析。This method eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a if `value` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `s`參數應該是以下列形式的十進位數字的字串表示：The `s` parameter should be the string representation of a decimal number in the following form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign. 有效的符號字元由和目前文化特性的屬性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的十進位數字的序列。A sequence of decimal digits ranging from 0 to 9.| > [!NOTE] > 所指定的字串`value`參數不能包含任何群組分隔符號或小數分隔符號，而且不得有小數部分。The string specified by the `value` parameter cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `s`參數會使用解譯樣式。The `s` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 除了十進位數字，只允許前置和後端空格，有前置正負號。In addition to the decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces with a leading sign are allowed. 若要明確地定義使用的文化特性特有格式設定資訊中可以存在的樣式項目`value`，呼叫方法。To explicitly define the style elements with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `value`, call the method. `s`參數使用的格式設定資訊中會剖析目前的文化特性的物件。The `s` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object for the current culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 這個多載會解譯中的所有位數`value`參數做為十進位數字。This overload interprets all digits in the `value` parameter as decimal digits. 若要剖析的十六進位數字的字串表示，呼叫改為多載。To parse the string representation of a hexadecimal number, call the overload instead. ## Examples 下列範例會嘗試將字串陣列中的轉換藉由呼叫值方法。The following example tries to convert the strings in an array to values by calling the method. eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a if `value` is invalid and cannot be parsed successfully. `style`參數定義中允許的樣式項目 （例如空白字元或正或負號）`value`剖析作業成功的參數。The `style` parameter defines the style elements (such as white space or a positive or negative sign) that are allowed in the `value` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必須從位元旗標的組合列舉型別。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 值而定`style`、`value`參數可以包含下列項目：Depending on the value of `style`, the `value` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] 如果`style`參數包含、`value`參數可以包含下列項目：If the `style` parameter includes , the `value` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*][*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space. 空白字元可以出現在開頭`value`如果`style`包含旗標，或結尾處`value`如果`style`包含旗標。White space can appear at the start of `value` if `style` includes the flag, or at the end of `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|特定文化特性的貨幣符號。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字串中的位置由定義屬性所傳回物件方法`provider`參數。Its position in the string is defined by the property of the object returned by the method of the `provider` parameter. 貨幣符號可以出現在`value`如果`style`包含旗標。The currency symbol can appear in `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign. 符號可以出現在開頭`value`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現在結尾`value`如果`style`包含旗標。The sign can appear at the start of `value` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `value` if `style` includes the flag. 括號可用於`value`來表示負數的值，如果`style`包含旗標。Parentheses can be used in `value` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*|從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9.| |*、**,*|特定文化特性的群組分隔符號。A culture-specific group separator. 所指定的文化特性的群組分隔符號`provider`可以出現在`value`如果`style`包含旗標。The group separator of the culture specified by `provider` can appear in `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*.**.*|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 所指定的文化特性的小數點符號`provider`可以出現在`value`如果`style`包含旗標。The decimal point symbol of the culture specified by `provider` can appear in `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*|數字 0 的一或多個項目。One or more occurrences of the digit 0. 小數點後數字才會出現在`value`才`style`包含旗標。Fractional digits can appear in `value` only if `style` includes the flag.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字元，表示此值會表示指數 （科學記號） 表示法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation. `value`參數可代表指數標記法之數字，如果`style`包含旗標。The `value` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*exponential_digits**exponential_digits*|從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9. `value`參數可代表指數標記法之數字，如果`style`包含旗標。The `value` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*hexdigits**hexdigits*|從 0 到 f 或 0 到 f 的十六進位數字的序列A sequence of hexadecimal digits from 0 through f, or 0 through F.| 十進位數字的字串 (對應於旗標) 一律會成功剖析。A string with decimal digits only (which corresponds to the flag) always parses successfully. 在其餘的大部分成員控制可能存在，但不一定要在此輸入字串中出現的項目。Most of the remaining members control elements that may be present, but are not required to be notation, along with *exponential_digits*. 如果`value`代表一個數字以指數標記法，它不能有非零的小數的元件。If `value` represents a number in exponential notation, it cannot have a non-zero, fractional component.| (*$*) element.| ||所有項目。All elements. 不過，`value`無法表示的十六進位數字或指數標記法之數字。However, `value` cannot represent a hexadecimal number or a number in exponential notation.| parameter can also use exponential notation.| ||*Ws*，*登*、 群組分隔符號 (*，*)，和小數點 (*。*) 項目。The *ws*, *sign*, group separator (*,*), and decimal point (*.*) elements.| ||所有項目。All elements. 不過，`value`無法表示的十六進位數字。However, `value` cannot represent a hexadecimal number.| 如果使用旗標，`value`必須是十六進位值。If the flag is used, `value` must be a hexadecimal value. 有效的十六進位數字是 0-9、 a-f 和 A-F。Valid hexadecimal digits are 0-9, a-f, and A-F. 只有其他旗標中可以存在`style`是和。The only other flags that can be present in `style` are and . (列舉型別的複合樣式，其中包含這兩個空格旗標。)(The enumeration has a composite style, , that includes both white-space flags.) > [!NOTE] > 如果`value`的字串表示法的十六進位數字，它無法前面的任何裝飾 (例如`0x`或`&h`)，區隔其十六進位數字。If `value` is the string representation of a hexadecimal number, it cannot be preceded by any decoration (such as `0x` or `&h`) that differentiates it as a hexadecimal number. 這會導致轉換失敗。This causes the conversion to fail. `provider`參數是實作。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法會傳回物件，提供特定文化特性格式資訊`value`。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of `value`. `provider`參數可以是下列任何一個：The `provider` parameter can be any one of the following: - A代表的文化特性，提供格式設定資訊的物件。A object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. 其方法會傳回提供該文化特性的數值格式設定資訊的物件。Its method returns the object that provides numeric formatting information for that culture. - A提供數值格式設定資訊的物件。A object that provides numeric formatting information. (它的實作只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of just returns itself.) - 自訂物件實作。A custom object that implements . 其方法具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method instantiates and returns the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`、物件會使用目前文化特性。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫方法以不同的字串的數字和值。The following example calls the method with a number of different string and values.
